job_title: Resident Service Coordinator in Martinsville, IN
pros: Helpful, responsive team. Working hard to make resident life appealing and successful. Cares about employees and community.
cons: Smaller company, pay is on lower side. Sometimes supervisors appear to be stretched thin with multiple roles.

job_title: State Tested Nursing Assistant (STNA) in Fairborn, OH
pros: The staff is all friendly and you have schedule flexibility upon notifying scheduler.
cons: The precautions and standards mostly in the Infection Control realm are completely unorganized and no communication is given between management to nurses or nurses to aids. There is also no maternity or paternity leave that is paid, or any other paid time off other than what you accrue, nor is there hazard pay for dementia/behavioral or COVID outbreaks.

pros: Overall everyone cared for residents and really tried
cons:
New management took over and changed things making it harder to correctly care for residents 
No gratefulness for loyal employees 
Felt walked all over

pros: Decent pto, longevity of some staff, residents
cons: Raises are miniscule or not at all, more interested in new staff more than who is there, bonus opportunities in some departments but not all, not rewarded for NOT being a problem.

pros: Caring staff, clean halls, good nurses
cons: Bed bugs, lack of aides, bad food

job_title: State Tested Nursing Assistant in Marietta, OH

review_title: Mission Accomplished at United Church Homes
pros: This company lives and breathes it's Mission, Vision and Core Values.  They genuinely care about the older population. They strive to meet the physical, social, emotional and spiritual needs of all that come to live on their campuses.
cons: As with all entities that operate to serve the needs of the older adult, there is never enough staff to meet all the demands of those individuals. The staff works hard and goes above and beyond to try but burn out occurs frequently.

pros: The only pro I can give, is the fact that I need this job until I find a better one.
cons: This place advertises competitive pay but that's completely not true. The nurses and aids, obviously, get paid more than someone from dietary, housekeeping and maintenance. Completely understaffed when it comes about the aids and the kitchen. They need to hire adults in the kitchen  because it's full of teenagers that are no call no shows, calling out 30mins before a shift and supervisors are basically nonexistent. I somewhat know what the place needs, but I simply stopped caring. I just work there.

review_title: Use Lord's name in vain to attract new employees
pros: Seemed like positive place with dogs and Jesus.
cons: Horribly understaffed and aides expected to work past state ratios.  Residents are expecting more.  Treated with rudeness from day one and I saw many quit just in 2   weeks.  They just walked out and I almost did today after being treated ride by the staff

review_title: Teamwork setting, open door policy, tenured employees
job_title: Director of Marketing in Sandusky, OH
pros: Good benefits and PTO with 401K.  Great leadership and nice on-boarding for new employees. All employees are eagerly willing to help.
cons: Have to wait for benefits to start after first 60 days. Those are the only cons I have at this time.

job_title: Clinical Nurse Manager in Fairborn, OH
pros: Lots of processes in place and makes everything run very smooth. In most LTC buildings 110 residents split between nurses would be insane, but, it was very doable here.
cons: Nursing homes are what they are. High ratios and staffing challenges are a way of life.
